title: Colin Salmon Avoids Driving Ban Due to Family Health Circumstances
summary: Colin Salmon, an actor famous for EastEnders and James Bond roles, expressed gratitude after avoiding a driving ban for a speeding offense in London. He was caught driving 24mph in a 20mph zone in March last year, adding three penalty points to his licence, which already had nine points from previous traffic violations. Typically, accumulating 12 points triggers an automatic six-month disqualification, but the court showed leniency. This decision was influenced by Salmon's personal circumstances: he cares for his seriously ill wife, Fiona Hawthorne, who has a rare lung condition and underwent a lung transplant, and his daughter Sasha, who has lymphoma. Salmon pleaded guilty, apologized on social media, and acknowledged the importance of speed limits. He was fined £666 with additional costs and surcharges, but avoided a ban, allowing him to continue driving his family to medical appointments. The case highlights how courts may consider mitigating factors in sentencing.
